ProgramElementNote.val:
ACV Increment 1.1 leverages and continues the work that was previously accomplished under the Marine Personnel Carrier (MPC) program, funded in PE 0206623M; Project 9C85.

Beginning in FY 2018, the program funding transitions from Program Element 0603611M Marine Corps Assault Vehicles to Program Element 0605611M MC AVS Development and Demonstration as the program proceeds through the acquisition process.

ProgramElementMissionDescription.val: The Amphibious Combat Vehicle is an armored personnel carrier, balanced in performance, protection, and payload for employment within the Ground Combat Element (GCE) and throughout the range of military operations, to include a swim capability.

SummaryExplanation.val: Beginning in FY 2018, the program funding transitions from Program Element 0603611M Marine Corps Assault Vehicles to Program Element 0605611M MC AVS Development and Demonstration as the program proceeds through the acquisition process.

ProjectMissionDescription.val:
The Amphibious Combat Vehicle is an armored personnel carrier, balanced in performance, protection, and payload for employment within the Ground Combat Element (GCE) and throughout the range of military operations, to include a swim capability. Funds support Amphibious Combat Vehicle (ACV) Increment 1.1 Engineering, Manufacturing and Development (EMD) contracts, Test & Evaluation (T&E) activities and associated program support.

ACV Increment 1.1 leverages and continues the work previously accomplished under the Marine Personnel Carrier (MPC) program, funded in PE 0206623M; Project 9C85.

Beginning in FY 2018, the program funding transitions from Program Element 0603611M Marine Corps Assault Vehicles to Program Element 0605611M MC AVS Development and Demonstration as the program proceeds through the acquisition process.

Description.val: System design and development; EMD test vehicle manufacturing; prime contractor Developmental and Operational test, and Logistics Management Information (LMI) data development.

Text.val:
- Completed EMD manufacturing and received 32 test vehicle deliveries. 
- Completed Vehicle Acceptance Review (VAR).
- Initiated break-in operations and acceptance testing.
- Initiated contractor Developmental Test activities.
- Initiated corrective action modifications that result from Reliability Growth Testing (RGT).

Description.val: Contract Advisory and Assistance Services (Engineering and Technical Support, Management Support Services, and Studies and Analyses).

Text.val:
- Continued business, acquisition, logistics, and engineering related activities for program document development, program analysis, acquisition logistics management, and financial management support. 
- Continued engineering and technical services for Amphibious Remote Weapon Station (ARWS), logistical, maintenance support, and integration.  
- Initiated force protection modeling and simulation activities.

Description.val: Government Developmental, Operational, and Live Fire Test and Evaluation activities.

Text.val:
- Initiated formation of the Operational Test (OT) team and began initial development of the OT detailed test plan.
- Initiated training for personnel to support execution of Developmental Test (DT), Operational Test, and Live Fire Test & Evaluation (LFT&E) events.  
- Initiated Developmental Test (DT) efforts for two vendors on 32 EMD test vehicles, such as: Land Mobility, Safety/Human Factors, Lethality, Water Mobility, Communication, and Survivability
- Initiated LFT&E activities.
- Initiated training for conduct of Operational Assessment (OA).

Description.val: Government labor, material, and travel for integrated logistics support, technical publications, support equipment development, in-house technical support, and program management support.

Text.val:
- Continued engineering support for communication suite integration efforts documented during technical information and review meetings.  
- Continued hydrodynamic model testing; Reliability, Availability, and Maintainability (RAM-D), and human systems integration activities.
- Continued procurement, inventory, checkout, kitting, shipment, and troubleshooting of ACV 1.1 communications suite Government Furnished Property (GFP) spares to support development test.
- Continued Digital Integration Facility (DIF) Architecture support.
- Initiated technical support for training packages.

AcquisitionStrategy.val: The program office awarded two competitive Engineering, Manufacturing and Development (EMD) contracts to two vendors to build 16 test vehicles each (32 total). ACV Increment 1.1 entered the acquisition cycle at Milestone B in FY 2016 and will down-select to one vendor at Milestone C.  In FY 2018, the program will enter into Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) and Full Rate Production (FRP) will begin in FY 2020.

PerformanceMetrics.val:
Milestone Reviews
Milestone B: 1QFY16
Milestone C: 3QFY18

Name.val: Test and Evaluation - EMD Detailed Planning
